Ceiling and Four Walls of a Room

label: Description
value: Against a gray background, ceiling at center. Upper wall has center fireplace with mirror above. Right wall has decorated panel, doors to left and right. Lower wall has console center with vases on it, mirror above. Left wall has console center, lamp and vases on it, curtained windows either side.

Proposed Design for the West Wall of the Music Room, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value:
Elevation of the west wall with two large wall-paintings flanking the fireplace. The panel to the left has as its central subject a lion trampling two dragon-serpents, while the frame above is composed of two coiled serpents. The panel to the right is made up of ornamental motifs with a lion at center. Within narrow painted panels to the far left and far right are figures of  devil-dancers.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory

label: Physical description
value: Watercolor over graphite on white wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane

Proposed Design for the West Wall of the Music Room, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Elevation of the west wall, with two large painted panels of Chinese lions flanking the fireplace. The panels are, in turn, flanked by columns entwined by serpents. Other detail and section of wall are sketched in or indicated by outline, in graphite.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on paper

Window Decoration, Probably for the East Wall of the Music Room, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Elevation of the east wall, showing a design for the decoration of the five windows which comprise this wall. Festoons of patterned and fringed drapery are held in place by carved snakes. On the piers between the windows are fluted draperies radiating from a central flower, and vertical folds. Carved cornice above.

label: Physical description
value: Watercolor, graphite on white wove paper

Design for Curtains, for the Music Room or the Banqueting Room, Brighton, Royal Pavilion

label: Description
value: Elevation of a wall, showing a design for the decoration of the five windows.  Swags of yellow and crimson drapery are upheld at the center by a flying dragon and tied at the sides by serpents. The intervening piers between the windows are covered by fluted drapery in yellow. Cornice in blue and gold.

Design for Curtains on the East Wall of the Music Room, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value:
Elevation of the east wall, showing a design for the decoration of the five windows which comprise this wall. Festooned drapery is upheld by a cornice made up mainly of winged dragons. Fluted curtains are hung in front of the piers between the windows.

Original album associated with this collection still exists.  See 1948-40-1 accessory.

Design for Wall Decoration, Yellow (North) Drawing Room, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Elevation of a wall. A series of five painted Chinese pictures are seen against a neutral yellow background, pairs of smaller paintings flanking the large central one. The central panel is enclosed in a painted frame, upheld by a bird with bright plumage. A painted railing below, section of molding above.

Design for a Wall Decoration, Possibly for the Corridor

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Panels left and right with fish, shells at base.  Patterned border below connecting the two panels. Blank central panel, obviously meant to carry some motif, is supported by a dado with a design of formal Chinese scrolls, and bordered on either side by upright panels bearing a design of fishes, moths, and desiccated threads.

label: Provenance
value: 1948: acquired by Museum (from Mrs. K. Gregory)

label: Description
value: Rocaille painted ornament, primarily gold and violet with roses. Other colors used in the ornament are pale pink and blue, sage, brown, and fuschia. The object has large s-curves and c-curves with floral sprays flowing down, up, and horizontally over the piece.

Design for a Painted Coach Panel with Rocaille Motif

label: Description
value: Almost symmetrical rocaille motif in green, brown, and gold on tan background.  The pattern is of a swirling, looping designs with wave-like detailing.  The materials drawn for this panel appear to be simililar to jade, bronze, silver, and gold.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache, gold paint on laid paper

value: Almost symmetrical rocaille motif in green, brown, and gold on tan background. The pattern is of a swirling, looping designs with wave-like detailing. The materials drawn for this panel appear to be simililar to jade, bronze, silver, and gold.

Letter from John Nash to Frederick Crace regarding Brighton Pavilion

label: Description
value: Letter; several lines of text. Transcription of the letter: Sir/ I am directed to inspect the/ designs you are painting for/Brighton. Iwill thank you/ to bring all the drawings here/ at 9 tomorrow morning/ particularly of the Chimney/ pieces & such as relates to the/ architectural or constructive/ parts of the Room and I /will thank you to be exactly at/ 9 as I am engaged at 10./ I [?]/ yours [?] [?]/ John Nash In lower left: [name of city?]/ May 19 1818; near bottom center: To Crace Esq.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink on off-white laid paper

Cross-section of the Théâtre de l'Ambigu Comique in Paris

label: Description

Design for the Entrance Hall, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Design for the Royal Pavilion, Brighton. Elevation of a wall, with a mantelpiece in the center, flanked by two doorways. Over the mantelpiece are painted circular and upright panels containing dragons. Columns with lotus-shaped capitals ornament the sides of the doorways, and a carved entablature above them. Carved cornice above.

label: Provenance
value: 1948: acquired by Museum (from Mrs. K. Gregory)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. John Innes Kane
Design for North wall, Yellow Drawing Room, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value: Elevation of a wall. A large central panel of large flowering plants and containers with flowers is flanked by two narrow panels of birds and plants. These are enclosed in frames which terminate at top in cusped arches in the Indian style, the entire decoration reflecting this taste.

label: Provenance
value: 1948: acquired by Museum (from Mrs. K. Gregory)

Wall Decoration (West) Wall, Music Room, Royal Pavilion, Brighton

label: Description
value: Elevation of a wall, with a mantelpiece indicated in the center. The walls to left and right are covered by painted panels, contained in wide decorative borders. At left, a seated Chinese lion and fling dragons. At right, a Chinese lion within a circular pendant and flying dragons.
